bibl.title: Ares: Brother, Commander, Deity or Son? A New Interpretation of the Ares Tombstone.
bibl.note: British Museum, Inv. GRA 1973.4-22.1 [Sc. 2271] (late Antonine period). - I. The Ares tombstone: A. Description of the relief scene; - B. Transcription and translation of the epitaph. - II. Identifying the "second" Ares: A. Identifying Ares: Brother, commander, fellow soldier, deity or deceased; - B. Identifying Ares: Son and heir. - Conclusion. - Pp. 338-339: Table I: Tombstones with two full-length standing male figures.
bibl.seg: Waebens Sofie, Ares: Brother, Commander, Deity or Son? A New Interpretation of the Ares Tombstone.
